author: Say Toaza
overview: Japanese Rhetoric Annotation Dataset (J-RAD) is a dataset of Japanese sentences annotated with rhetorical devices.
purpose: The purpose of this dataset is to provide a resource for studying rhetorical devices in Japanese text.

fields.name: rhetorical_device
fields.description: List of rhetorical devices present in the sentences.

fields.name: text
fields.example: 新しいカヤックの機能性については、私はこのように評価しているのですが、あなたはどのように感じられますか?私の意見に同意されますか?

data_collection_method: Data was collected by LLM-based text generation with prompts for rhetorical devices.
known_issues: This dataset does not contain phonological rhetorical devices, which are difficult to represent with LLMs.
The dataset may contain some noise due to the nature of LLM-based text generation.
maintenance_plan: Updates will be released quarterly based on user feedback and new data availability.
